confirm.title: Delete Companion
confirm.content: Are you sure you want to delete this companion?

storeonactor.title: Store Companions on Actor
storeonactor.hint: Store the companions on the actor instead of the user by default.

enableautomations.title: Enable Automations
enableautomations.hint: Enable the companion automation system on spellcast.

autoclose.title: Auto-Close
autoclose.hint: Automatically close the companion window after summoning.

hidebutton.title: Hide Companion Button
hidebutton.hint: Hide the companion button on the character sheet.

restrictOwned.title: Only Owned Actors
restrictOwned.hint: Restrict the companion list to only show owned companions actors.

restrictOnlyGM.title: Only GM can see Companion button
restrictOnlyGM.hint: Restrict the companion list to GMs only

removeLabelSheetHeader.title: Remove label from sheet header button
removeLabelSheetHeader.hint: Remove label from sheet header button useful for small monitor, tablet

hudColumn.title: HUD Column
hudColumn.hint: Which HUD column to place the button in

hudTopBottom.title: HUD Top/Bottom
hudTopBottom.hint: Where to place the button in the column

hudEnable.title: Enable token HUD feature
hudEnable.hint: Avoid the rendering of the companion manager for fast evocation when click on the hud button. All the entities with a 'default summon type' setted on the token/actor configuration, will let you avoid the rendering of the companion manager, can be really useful for fast combat, there two options 'random' and 'ordered' you can't enable both. Remember you must own the token for see the HUD button
